description.narrative: Tropical fruit production is typically undertaken by workers with low wages and limited social benefits. Working conditions are poor and health and safety conditions extremely hazardous with intensive use of agrochemicals and highly demanding physical work. Governments keen to secure foreign investment and generate employment opportunities are not always effective in enforcing national legislation on labour standards. Women on plantations are often unaware of or unable to realise their rights. Supermarkets have begun to recognise the flaws in a system where they pay very low prices yet demand high quality standards while espousing a message of corporate social responsibility. This project will increase the capacity of unions to educate their members and other workers about their rights and to negotiate effectively for living wages and improved conditions. Consumer awareness will be raised to keep the pressure on the industry to change its behaviour and respect workers’ rights
